isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES - TIRE CARE - ROTATION

step1.para: If front (steering) axle tires become irregularly worn, move to rear drive axle or trailer position.
In a dual assembly, if one tire wears much faster than its mate, reverse position of tires.
If tires are highway type tread design:

Front (Steering) Axle - When required, replace tire when tire tread is worn to 1/8 inch (3.17mm) or less. Rotate worn tires to any other position. Retreaded or recapped tires are not to be used on steering axles.
Rear and Trailer Axles - Tires must be removed when tread is worn to no less than 1/16 inch (1.58mm). However, tires identified by the word "regroovable" molded on the sidewall can be regrooved.
If rib or highway type tire is used on front axle and lug or off-road type on rear axle positions:
Front (Steering Axle)- Install new tires at front wheels when tread is worn to 1/8 inch (3.17mm) or less. These tires can be moved to trailer positions.
Rear and Trailer Axles - Tires must be removed when the tread is worn to 1/16 inch (1.58mm) or less. Tires identified with the word "regroovable" molded on the sidewall can be regrooved.
